as.leap

Class LCESQuery<T extends LCObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • as.leap.LCESQuery<T>

  • public class LCESQuery<T extends LCObject>
extends java.lang.Object
    The LCESQuery class defines an es query that is used to fetch LCObjects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LCESQuery

        public LCESQuery(java.lang.Class<T> subClass)
        Constructs a query for a LCObject subclass type. A default query with no further parameters will retrieve all LCObjects of the provided class.
        Parameters:
        subClass - The LCObject subclass type to retrieve.

      • LCESQuery

        public LCESQuery(java.lang.String className)
        Constructs a query. A default query with no further parameters will retrieve all LCObjects of the provided class.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class to retrieve LCObjects for.

    • Method Detail

      • getQuery

        public static <T extends LCObject> LCESQuery<T> getQuery(java.lang.Class<T> subclass)
        Creates a new query for the given LCObject subclass type. A default query with no further parameters will retrieve all LCObjects of the provided class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        subclass - The LCObject subclass type to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A new LCESQuery.

      • getQuery

        public static <T extends LCObject> LCESQuery<T> getQuery(java.lang.String className)
        Creates a new query for the given class name. A default query with no further parameters will retrieve all LCObjects of the provided class name.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends LCObject
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class to retrieve LCObjects for.
        Returns:
        A new LCESQuery.

      • addAscendingOrder

        public LCESQuery<T> addAscendingOrder(java.lang.String key)
        Also sorts the results in ascending order by the given key. The previous sort keys have precedence over this key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to order by.
        Returns:
        Returns the query so you can chain this call.

      • addDescendingOrder

        public LCESQuery<T> addDescendingOrder(java.lang.String key)
        Also sorts the results in descending order by the given key. The previous sort keys have precedence over this key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to order by.
        Returns:
        Returns the query so you can chain this call.

      • getClassNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getClassNames()

      • setLimit

        public LCESQuery<T> setLimit(int limit)
        Controls the maximum number of results that are returned. Setting a negative limit denotes retrieval without a limit. The default limit is 100, with a maximum of 1000 results being returned at a time.
        Parameters:
        limit - the limit
        Returns:
        Returns the query, so you can chain this call.

      • getLimit

        public int getLimit()
        Accessor for the limit.
        Returns:
        the limit

      • setSkip

        public LCESQuery<T> setSkip(int skip)
        Controls the number of results to skip before returning any results. This is useful for pagination. Default is to skip zero results.
        Parameters:
        skip - the skip
        Returns:
        Returns the query, so you can chain this call.

      • getSkip

        public int getSkip()
        Accessor for the skip value.
        Returns:
        the skip
